713547f-a.title: Manhattan: 51st Street (West) - 6th Avenue
713547f-a.text:
(1)
west 51st Street, south side,g.fro, but not including Sixth Ave.
Shown thru clearance at the S.W. corner of Fifth Ave., is St. Patrick's
Cathedral. Across the background, appears the General Electric Build-

Noveuber 2, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.

(2)

November 13, 1932.

709570f-a.title: Manhattan: 6th Avenue - 51st Street (West)
709570f-a.text:
(1)
Sixth Ave., west side, north from (No. 1287), but not including
West 51st Street. No. 1287 being a portion of building at the N.W. cor-
ner of 51st Street. Shown under demolition are Nos. 1289 to 1297 (at,
adjoining and south of the S.W. corner of West 52nd Street). The Sixth
Ave. Elevated Line, as shown turns westward on 53rd Street.
March 1E, 1937.
L. Sperr.
NO REPPODUCTIONS.
(2)
The same, slightly later. Note further demolition of buildings at
the S.W. corner of 52nd Street.
March 30, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

713553f-a.title: Manhattan: 51st Street (West) - 6th Avenue
713553f-a.text:
West i1st Street, south side, east from
Seventh to Sixth Avenue's, showing the northerly
side of the New York Railway's carbarn. This
has been replaced by the present Hotel Taft.
October 6, 1915
Borough President of Manhattan
MAY BE REPRODUCED
No. 883

713554f.title: Manhattan: 51st Street (West) - 6th Avenue
713554f.text:
West 5lst Street, south side, west from a point slightly west of
Sixth, to Seventh Aves., showing a further portion of the New York Railroad
carbarn under demolition. West of same appears the Roxy Theatre and the
Hotel Manger (Hotel Taft, 1938), both located upon what in 1925 was
occupied by a similar structure to that shown under destruction. At that
date the entire block appears as a carbarn. In 1938, the now being cleared
site, will remain vacant. This set consists of a negative and a positive.
December 12, 1927.
F. M. 1emarest.
Oift of Albert A. Volk Co.
CREDIT LINE IMPERATIVE ON ALL REPRODUCTIONS.

713548f-a.title: Manhattan: 51st Street - 6th Avenue
713548f-a.text:
51st Street, north side, east from but not including,Sinth
Avenue.
September 28, 1930.
P.L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

713552f-a.title: Manhattan: 51st Street (West) - 6th Avenue
713552f-a.text:
West 5lst Street, east from (No. 127) a point between Seventh and
Sirth Aves., showing automobile parking spaces on both sides of the street,
with a portion of the Sixth Ave. Elevated Line on Sixth Ave. On the south
side of the street (right), appears the lower floors of the 31-story
R.N.0. Building, at the S.E. corner of Sixth Ave., and in the background,
the 50-story deneral Electric Building, at the S.W. corner of Lexington Ave.
March 30, 1937.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

713545f-b.title: Manhattan: 51st Street - 6th Avenue
713545f-b.text:
(1)
51st Street east from, but not including, Sixth Avenue.
September 28, 1930.
P.L. Sperr.
NO REPRODOCTIONS.
(2)
A view of the south side, at a later date, and showing
further demolition in progress at the S.W. corner of Fifth Ave.
On the extreme right appearing a portion of the new R.K.O. Ruild-
ing. Prominently shown are the General Electric Building, St.
Patrick's Cathedral, the Waldorf-Astoria Hotel and No. 444 Madison
Ave.
Sephember 11, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

713546f-b.title: Manhattan: 51st Street (West) - 6th Avenue
713546f-b.text:
West 5lst Street, south side, east from Sixth Ave. Shown thru
the steel lattice work of a unit of Radio City, at the S.W. corner od
Fifth Ave., is St. Patrick's Cathedral, R.C. Other prominent struct-
ures are respectively from left to right, the General Electric Building,
the Waldorf-Astoria Hotel and No. 444 Madison Ave. On the extrene
right appears a portion of Sak's Dept. Store.
October 22, 1932.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
The same, slightly eastward.
October 22, 1932.
P. L. SPerr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.

713549f-c.title: Manhattan: 51st Street (West) - 6th Avenue
713549f-c.text:
(1)
West 51st Street, st, adjoining and east of the N.E. corner of Sixth
Ave. (Elevated Line), as seen across clearance for Radio City and from
68 West 48th Street. Also shown (foreground) is 49th and 50th Streets.
(70 story R.C.A. Building site) with its 3-story corner buildings.
October 21, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPPODUCTIONS.
(2)
Another view, but not showing West 49th Street. The excavation
shown on the east side of Sixth Ave., and between 50th and 51st Streets,
will be the site of the 31-story R.K.O. Building and the 8-story Inter-
national Music Hall.
October 21, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
(3)
A similar angle and showing a more extensive view no:thward.
October 21, 1931.
P. L. Sperr.
NO REPRODUCTIONS.
